name: UXfolio Case Study Template
description:
Design your case studies with both the specialized structure of UXfolio and the fluidity of Figma at your disposal.


This template emulates UXfolio’s WYSIWYG editor within Figma via Auto layouts & Variants so you can experiment with your document structure more flexibly, then recreate your final design on uxfol.io for full publication.


By first drafting in Figma, you gain access to certain functionality currently not available on the UXfolio site, including:

  • Access to zoom for a bird’s eye view of your full document
  • Including screencaps of other case studies next to yours as references on length and structure
  • An extensive undo history and version control
  • Reorganizing content sections by directly dragging them up and down in the document
  • Creating multiple versions of a section, then toggling their visibility without deleting them
  • Adjusting the fill & cropping of your images within the context of your document (+the ability to convert adjusted images into assets for UXfolio via Figma's Export panel)


In addition to these Figma features, this template also provides:

  • Text-based placeholders for jotting down image ideas
  • A “Draft” effect to help distinguish draft vs final sections
  • A component that lets you cycle through multiple reference case studies next to your draft
  • Tips and walkthroughs to help with Auto Layout and Variant reliant features


Hope you're able to get some use and enjoyment from this template!


January 20 updates:

  • I've recreated the last outstanding visual customization option from the UXfolio site (the "outline/realistic/etc." visual styles for mockup devices)
  • Some updated nesting and renaming ("Basic Section" now appears as "ROW" in the layers panel)
  • Thumbnail now inherits project title to help differentiate projects from each other
  • Simplified implementation of "Display Property" for "Image & Text" section types
  • Easier access to the placeholder notes (now activated via a toggle on Image Container and mockup devices)


December 16 updates:

  • Overhauled variants structure so that options now directly mirror UXfolio's
  • Overhauled nesting to reduce clicking and extraneous layers
  • Fixes to Auto layout bugs
  • Simpler custom templates for images and reference case studies
  • Improvements to the template instructions
